messages.message: Hi Russia, It seems we are pitted against some dangerous opponents this time
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hi Russia, It seems we are pitted against some dangerous opponents this time'.

messages.message: I do plan to F Ank -Bla. If you wish you may wish to F Sev - Bla as well.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I do plan to F Ank -Bla. If you wish you may wish to F Sev - Bla as well.'.

messages.message: Hi Russia, I think we should come to some mutual understanding here or things will turn out bad for the both of us.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hi Russia, I think we should come to some mutual understanding here or things will turn out bad for the both of us.'.

messages.message: Look -- I know I took Sev, but I will not be able to take Moscov and it's honestly a waste of time for the both of us. I'd rather focus on Austria & Italy.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Look -- I know I took Sev, but I will not be able to take Moscov and it's honestly a waste of time for the both of us. I'd rather focus on Austria & Italy.'.

messages.message: If you decommision the fleet in Bla I will attempt to move out of Sev.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'If you decommision the fleet in Bla I will attempt to move out of Sev.'.

messages.message: And go to Rumania
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'And go to Rumania'.

messages.message: I was going to decommission the army in Prussia. You can just move the army to Romania and I’ll return the fleet to Sev. I’m willing to help you switch your focus to AH and Italy, and even help you eventually but we need to build the trust before I decommission the fleet in Black Sea I think.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I was going to decommission the army in Prussia. You can just move the army to Romania and I’ll return the fleet to Sev. I’m willing to help you switch your focus to AH and Italy, and even help you eventually but we need to build the trust before I decommission the fleet in Black Sea I think.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's response demonstrates a willingness to collaborate and build trust by proposing a coordinated move, implying a genuine intent to work together towards common goals in the future phases of the game.

messages.message: Honestly the smarter move would have been for us to work together from the beginning but there’s a lot of innate distrust built in to the game between Russia and Turkey haha.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Honestly the smarter move would have been for us to work together from the beginning but there’s a lot of innate distrust built in to the game between Russia and Turkey haha.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's candid acknowledgment of the historical dynamics between Russia and Turkey, coupled with the recognition of the benefits of early collaboration, indicates a genuine understanding of the game's complexities and a sincere desire to overcome past barriers to cooperation for mutual success.

messages.message: Turkey and Russia are great allies. The rough part is the fleet in Bla. If we can get past that things could much better for both of us.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Turkey and Russia are great allies. The rough part is the fleet in Bla. If we can get past that things could much better for both of us.'.

messages.message: As far as I can see, the fleet in Bla does not serve you a strategic purpose since I cannot afford to move more units north without giving up my flank to Austria
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'As far as I can see, the fleet in Bla does not serve you a strategic purpose since I cannot afford to move more units north without giving up my flank to Austria'.

messages.message: And of course I cannot take Moscow with just 1 army.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'And of course I cannot take Moscow with just 1 army.'.

messages.message: I do expect my Sev army to get bounced at least in spring though but with the fleet in Bla I can F Bla S A Sev - Rum
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I do expect my Sev army to get bounced at least in spring though but with the fleet in Bla I can F Bla S A Sev - Rum'.

messages.message: Ok that makes sense. The Black Sea sucks.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Ok that makes sense. The Black Sea sucks.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's acknowledgment of the strategic challenges related to the Black Sea and agreement with Turkey's reasoning demonstrates an understanding of the situation and suggests a willingness to cooperate effectively to navigate the complexities of the game board.

messages.message: Feel free to A War - Mos just in case. However, I would appreciate having an alliance in the future. Do you think there's a possibilty for you attack Budapest? I could support you from Rum
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Feel free to A War - Mos just in case. However, I would appreciate having an alliance in the future. Do you think there's a possibilty for you attack Budapest? I could support you from Rum'.

messages.message: Then, in turn, I can get Serbia
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Then, in turn, I can get Serbia'.

messages.message: I am sad to see you changed your mind.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I am sad to see you changed your mind.'.

messages.message: Doesn’t really matter anymore. I’m done.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Doesn’t really matter anymore. I’m done.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's statement of being "done" could suggest a resignation or possible disinterest in continuing the game, but it lacks specific context or a clear indication of their intentions, which may lead to uncertainty about the future actions and strategies in the game.

messages.message: Wished it could've turned out differently. I honestly was willing to work with you last year
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Wished it could've turned out differently. I honestly was willing to work with you last year'.

messages.message: Yea, honestly I screwed up from the beginning. We should have teamed up from the beginning. Was my first t8me as Russia and I failed spectacularly haha.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Yea, honestly I screwed up from the beginning. We should have teamed up from the beginning. Was my first t8me as Russia and I failed spectacularly haha.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's acknowledgment of their early missteps and recognition of the potential benefits of collaboration suggest a genuine willingness to reflect on past actions and consider future cooperation, indicating a positive attitude towards building a more effective partnership in the game.

messages.message: I think, yeah, 1901 went extremely poorly for you but I think I had a decent plan for your recover at least. Not sure if could've won but at least restored to 4 CP and then push into austria
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I think, yeah, 1901 went extremely poorly for you but I think I had a decent plan for your recover at least. Not sure if could've won but at least restored to 4 CP and then push into austria'.

messages.message: I basically ignored you and pushed East to Germany right away. Terrible strategy as Russia.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I basically ignored you and pushed East to Germany right away. Terrible strategy as Russia.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's frank assessment of their strategy as Russia, acknowledging their mistake in ignoring Turkey and focusing on advancing towards Germany early on, indicates a willingness to recognize errors and learn from them, fostering a more constructive and collaborative approach in future interactions.

messages.message: I mean, you could've grabbed berlin but decied to hold in Pru. That confused me greatly. At the same time germany and england were conspiring against you with northern openings
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I mean, you could've grabbed berlin but decied to hold in Pru. That confused me greatly. At the same time germany and england were conspiring against you with northern openings'.

messages.message: England was talking to me about going after Germany.i know now that was BS. Anyway, I shouldn’t have gone after Germany right away anyway.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'England was talking to me about going after Germany.i know now that was BS. Anyway, I shouldn’t have gone after Germany right away anyway.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's acknowledgment of the misinformation from England about targeting Germany, along with the recognition of the flawed decision to focus on Germany too early, demonstrates a growing awareness of the dynamics and potential pitfalls in the game, indicating a more discerning and strategic approach to future alliances and actions.

messages.message: Yeah, retrospect is easy.  I'm expecting A Gal -War. At least I'm not going to move A Sev - Rum so perhaps you can block austria from getting too far ahead?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Yeah, retrospect is easy.  I'm expecting A Gal -War. At least I'm not going to move A Sev - Rum so perhaps you can block austria from getting too far ahead?'.

messages.message: Unless you wish to exit the game quickly, then A Mos  -Ukr would be appreciated 😃
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Unless you wish to exit the game quickly, then A Mos  -Ukr would be appreciated 😃'.
